Program Info

This is a program for recording conversation and adding notes to the recorded conversations.
After you end the call, the program will ask if you would like to save the recording of the conversation onto the memory card. The program helps you to keep records of important conversations and to find them in the history of conversations, thanks to the text and visual notes. Having Call Recording makes working with a large number of clients a breeze.

First calls

Immediately after installation of the program the list of recorded conversations is empty. What a surprise! :) At this moment you do not have any recorded conversations and in order to test the program you need to make a phone call to any number as you normally would. After that, launch Call Recording and you will see your conversation in the list of recorded calls. Now you can hear it by pressing the "Play" button.

Program interface

The Program Interface consists of several pages.

CALLS - contains the history of all saved conversations, grouped by days.

NOTES - contains a similar list but only shows recorded conversations that have a note attached to them.

DIALOGUES - contains a similar list of all recorded conversations, but this list is grouped by client.

PLANNED - contains calls that you have planned to make in the future. Here the sorting order is reversed, the earliest planned call will be at the top of the list.

How to write a note during conversation

Often, when we are talking with someone, it is necessary to record some information that he/she dictates. This could be a phone number, address or other important piece of information.

In order to add a note to an ongoing conversation all you have to do is pull down the notification panel at the top of the screen, and select the icon for Call Recording, and you will get a screen where you can add a note to the conversation. Therefore, you are able to speak with a person and type keywords and information, which you will than see in the list of conversations, next to the phone number of the client.

I can\'t hear the other person talking in the recorded conversation. What to do?

All conversations recorded by the program are responsibility of the Audio Source. If you go into configuration and choose Audio Source you will see the following 5 options:
  1. Default
  2. Microphone
  3. Voice Uplink
  4. Voice Downlink
  5. Voice Call (input and output streams)
The names of these Sources are deceptive and could cause confusion, because every current manufacturer of mobile phones interprets them as it is convenient for them. On certain models of phones microphone recording captures both streams, but on others both streams are captured when the Output Stream option is selected. All that we can do is experiment in order to achieve the correct recording configuration. We hope that in the near future, manufacturers of devices will more strictly adhere to specifications from Android and the names of sound sources will correspond to how the device will actually record.

The first option, Default, is supported by every device, and thereby we set it as the default after installation. When using this option some devices record both streams, but some record only your voice. Try selecting a different Recording Source and to re-record the conversation. Also it is important to note that some telephone models do not support recording of two-way streams without Root-Permissions.

Invisible mode

Call Recording can be configured to work in the Invisible mode. For this all you do is remove the checkmark of the Icon in status panel and set configuration named Conversation recording to Record all.

This way the program will not ask you "Would you like to save this conversation?" at the end of a phone call, and the application icon at the top of the screen will not be visible. Now your Call Recording is working in the invisible mode.
